verses.roman:
āśramān ṛṣi-mukhyānāṁ
kṛtvā bhagna-vanaspatīn
adūṣayac chakṛn-mūtrair
agnīn vaitānikān khalaḥ

synonyms: āśramān—the spiritual communities; ṛṣi—of sages; mukhyānām—exalted; kṛtva—making; bhagna—broken; vanaspatīn—whose trees; adūṣayat—he contaminated; mūtraiḥ—and urine; agnīn—the fires; vaitānikān—sacrificial; khalaḥ—wicked.
translation: The wicked ape tore down the trees in the hermitages of exalted sages and contaminated their sacrificial fires with his feces and urine.
